name: Bernardus Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a 1 night stay at Bernardus. I can't believe we have lived in the area for 20 years and have never been there. From the moment we arrived we were treated exceptional. Tim from valet greeted us with a smile and remembered our name the following day. We loved the attention to details they took at the hotel. Our only regret was not staying 2 nights.
reviews.title: Five star all the way!

reviews.text: Room-The bed was very comfortable. Loved all the amenities in the room. We enjoyed the complementary wine and cheese. The view of the Carmel Valley was beautiful.
reviews.title: If I could give 6 STARS I would!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In- Very personal. Greeted us with a smile. They offer you a glass of wine right when you walk in. They showed us around the property and walked us to our room.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING!

reviews.text: Spa-Very nice!! One of the best massages we have ever had. Every amenity in the spa you can think of. Visiting the spa is a must!
reviews.title: Outstanding!! First class hotel and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Gym-small but nice. They had a little of everything, including headphones and bottles of water.
reviews.title: First time staying, hope it wont be our last

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel is so peaceful and relaxing, with very comfortable rooms and was much nicer than we expected and set in lovely grounds. There is a complimentary 'wine grotto' in the room, which includes wine, goats cheese, crackers, popcorn brownies, chips, etc. Spa quality toiletries. Beautiful spa and excellent food. There is a lovely outdoor fireplace to relax by after dinner, or petanqe if you feel more energetic. The staff are very warm and welcoming. We wouldn't heisitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Wonderfully relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had the pleasure to stay here during Labor Day Weekend. The service was top notch. They give you a glass of wine when you check in. Since it was our first time here, they give you a tour before escorting you to your room. I love when hotels do the check in procedures in the comforts of your room. We stayed in the luxury room which was overlooking the croquet lawn. We got lucky because it was a beautiful sunny weekend in Carmel Valley. The room was large with a gas fireplace. Also, we enjoyed the complimentary mini-bar which included 3 half-bottles of their wines. My husband and I plan to stay here again when we feel like just getting away. We booked a package for our room that came with breakfast. It was amazing how quick room service was. I also recommend dining at Marinus. It is an exceptional experience.
reviews.title: Best place for a Romantic Getaway
Lovely place to stay
reviews.text: Stayed here with family and had a great time. Lovely atmosphere and good food and wine. The place is perhaps a fraction dated but the welcome and ambience made it hardly matter. Would definitely return and against the odds it was the favourite hotel of my 6 year old son on our recent trip....

My 13 year old son and I stayed at the Bernardus Lodge. It was a spontaneous trip. Other hotels not available. The setting is beautiful. The service was amazing and the room we had was great. I am a vegan. The chef at the lodge not only accommodated me but gave me my own special menu with various vegan options. It is a 5 star resort and it did live up to what you would expect from a luxurious resort. My only negative comment about the resort is the fitness center. It is small with very limited equipment. Not up to the standards of the rest of the hotel. There were a few other families at the hotel, while my son and I had a great time I would REALLY recommend Bernardus for adults. Highly recommend for a romantic getaway. Would not recommend for families.
reviews.title: Romantic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a most pleasant stay at Bernardus Lodge in Carmel Valley. Top drawer in every respect. Wish I could live there! Spa was exceptional...all staff most helpful, pleasant and friendly. Room was large with gas fireplace and complimentary mini-bar including some Bernardus wine. Lovely deck off room was perfect place to sit outside overlooking pool and drink wine Grounds are lovely. A truly exceptional place...worth every penny! I hope to be back many, many times!
reviews.title: Best of the Best at Bernardus

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the second time we have stayed at Bernardus. We went same time last year. Stayed three nights and enjoyed every minute. Had a great room overlooking the pool. Rooms come with complimentary wine and snacks which is lovely and there is fresh fruit and flowers in the room. The beds are extremely comfortable and there is a cosy fireplace in the room.
reviews.title: Great place for relaxation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had breakfast each morning at Wickets and the breakfast was delicious. We also had dinner one evening and I had a lunch. The only disappointment was the chicken I had for dinner. I do not eat much red meat or chicken but last year I had the chicken and it was so good I had it twice. I was looking forward to the same juicy delicious chicken. The chicken I got this time was tough so once was enough. This was the exception as all the other food was wonderful.
reviews.title: Absolutely Stunning.

reviews.text: Staff are friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Staying at Bernardus Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa is wonderful and I had a full day of pampering. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: Beauty up on the hill

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from a lovely stay on the Monterey Peninsula. Bernardus being one of our stops. We went for a wedding. We went with a dear friend who was a part of the team that designed it. So we were able to learn all the back stories about why they chose e-v-e-r-y little detail. Fascinating. We enjoyed every aspect of the place. The staff and amenities were equally amazing. Wedding was stunning. I recommend when you come here to remember it is to relax. You need to stay on the resort to get the whole experience. Marinus has won too many awards to mention and deserve their high Zagat score. Wine collection off the charts. The rooms are very tasteful and good in size. There were 3 different Bernardus wine bottle for free as well as gourmet goodies and camembert cheese and crackers in our room as well as fresh fruit and waters, juices and sodas. They do not nickle and dime you here. A fire place and huge soaker tub that fills up in 40 seconds. Like I said, it's the details in this place. Apparently, we just missed Bradley Cooper and Leonardo DiCaprio is a regular.
reviews.title: Just great - nothing more to say

reviews.text: Very welcoming, great hospitality and personalised service. Very beautiful rooms/cottages with fireplace. Excellent sleeping comfort, Beautiful spa and pool area. Restaurant is the best there is in the direct surrounding. Very nice surrounding Carmen Valley.
reviews.title: Bernardus Lodge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bones of the hotel are good, but the experience is marred by dated decor, some of it truly ugly (I'm talking window treatments, shower curtain frou-frou,etc.). Our room was spacious and well-proportioned, but tired. The plantings by our outdoor hot tub were just pathetic, and the faded signs by the hot tub (which date from another millenium) were full of typos. At these prices, details matter. Somebody needs to pay attention; a cosmetic upgrade is overdue.
reviews.title: Needs a refresh
Outstanding!
reviews.text: We stayed two nights and had a fabulous, very relaxing time. The rooms are well appointed and we had a spacious, airy suite with a large, shady balcony. The public areas are very attractive and extremely well maintained. At teh time of our visit the occupancy seemed rather low so the pool was nice and quiet. The hotel has quite a diverse staff and they are all very friendly as highly professional. The spa is fabulous and the treatments were excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had lunch and dinner at Wickets. The lunch was great with very good food and faultless service but the dinner was mildly disappointing....the service was quite slow and not quite as attentive as lunch and the shaved truffle pizza was not well cooked for the price and came without some of the ingredients. Room service breakfast was awesome.
reviews.title: A short, but great, stay!

reviews.text: Overall, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but not luxury and low value
Intimate, elegant and professional
reviews.text: Need I say more? The Bernardus Lodge is everything you may want for a romantic Carmel getaway. The grounds are beautiful, the staff are the ultimate in professionalism (without being stuffy) and the whole place just "screams" relaxation!

reviews.title: Excellent
reviews.text: We've stayed in so many ramshackles calling themselves hotels in downtown Carmel by the Sea that we were happy to upgrade to the more relaxing atmosphere, better weather and beautiful scenery of Carmel Valley. We only stayed one night in the Fall (so no pool activity) and the hotel was not entirely full but the vibe was definitely serene.

reviews.title: Perfect Get-Away
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious and immaculate but could use a bit of "contemporizing". The bed, linens and towels are top notch. The snacks and welcome wine are a very nice touch.

reviews.title: Unbelievably Relaxing and Private
reviews.text: It was nice to walk to dinner at Marinus rather than have to drive into Carmel Valley or downtown. It was an OUTSTANDING meal with service to match!! It was fine dining at it's finest without being pretentious or stuffy.

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: We will return!

description: Luxury spa that combines elegant country living with luxurious amenities found in only the best European hotels.
